response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<String> it = windowsid.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  System.out.println(it.next());

<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new windowsid.iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject:I have a JSONObject and i want to get the value of a key in it.I have tried this code:JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);String key = jsonObject.getString("key");But it is not working.Please help me.
Please using this api: JSONObject.getString("key").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.getString("key")
<<<code>>>: String key = jsonObject.getString("key");
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new JSONObject(jsonString) in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
